title: 4,000 miles from the earthquake, mourning Moroccans come together to help
description: Many Moroccans in the Washington area have spent the days since the deadly earthquake supporting and fundraising. The response has “been amazing.”

title: Mangosuthu Buthelezi, former Mandela rival in South Africa, dies at 95
description: Enigmatic and divisive, Mr. Buthelezi nearly disrupted 1994 elections that brought Nelson Mandela to power to end White rule in South Africa.

title: Waiting for aid in Morocco
description: Today on “Post Reports,” why an earthquake in Morocco was so deadly, the anger over the government response, and what survivors say they need now.

title: Mapping why Libya’s floods were so deadly
description: Eastern Libya’s weak infrastructure and low-lying geography made it especially vulnerable to catastrophic flooding.

title: Anatol Ugorski, long-hidden talent of classical piano, dies at 80
description: Long suppressed by Soviet authorities, he immigrated to Germany in the early 1990s and revealed himself to the music world as an artist of extraordinary talent.

title: Republican hopefuls ramp up war talk over Mexican border
description: The aggressive proposals anger Mexican officials while analysts doubt they would be effective to stop the flow of drugs.

title: George W. Bush recalls dinner served by Wagner’s Prigozhin: ‘I survived’
description: George W. Bush said former Wagner mercenary chief Yevgeniy Prigozhin, nicknamed “Putin’s chef,” once served him dinner at a G-8 summit in St. Petersburg.

title: U.K. proposes ban on American XL bully dogs, prompting fierce debate
description: The British government wants to ban the XL bully breed after violent attacks, prompting debate over who should be at fault: the pets or their owners?

title: In photos, videos: Libya floods bring ‘catastrophe’ to Derna
description: Storm Daniel brought torrential rain and extreme flooding to northeastern Libya, devastating cities like Derna as floodwaters burst dams and washed away cars.

title: Thousands missing and feared dead, after floods submerge eastern Libya
description: The flooding caused by Storm Daniel has been particularly acute in the city of Derna with government estimating that up to 9,000 people are missing.

title: Philippine court acquits Nobel laureate Maria Ressa of final charges
description: Under former president Rodrigo Duterte, Nobel laureate Maria Ressa and her outlet Rappler were inundated by court cases that critics say muzzled the free press.

title: Protests rage as Israel’s Supreme Court considers judicial overhaul
description: Following eight months of street protests, the issues are now distilled into legal arguments over the division of powers in a country with no written constitution.

title: Dozens of escaped crocodiles lurking in floodwaters, Chinese city warns
description: Back-to-back typhoons flooded a crocodile farm in southern China’s Guangdong province, providing an escape for at least 75 crocodiles. Most are still at large.

title: Ukraine live briefing: Kim Jong Un arrives in Russia; Kyiv recaptures strategic oil rigs
description: The North Korean leader crossed into Russia aboard a private train. Washington expects that Kim and President Vladimir Putin will discuss an arms deal.

title: American rescued after being trapped in Turkish cave for more than a week
description: It took 57 hours to rescue Mark Dickey from one of Turkey’s deepest caves after he suffered gastrointestinal bleeding on a research expedition.

title: 50 years after Chile’s coup, many still yearn for right-wing strongmen
description: The reactionary zeal that drove Augusto Pinochet’s coup in Chile can still be seen in various democracies around the world, including the United States.
